flow.descriptionCdata:
d85a39d4-7d29-4054-8eea-9c076eed8504.0503b594-72a4-4027-a741-0955af24bd60.description=This flow with send an email notifying the Support team that the email notification to the creator failed. Input Values\: vm.requester.email - The email address from the prior step result htmldocument - THe email body text from the prior result d85a39d4-7d29-4054-8eea-9c076eed8504.2b4b08f3-932b-418b-8947-6e844911e82c.description=Generic flow to send an e-mail d85a39d4-7d29-4054-8eea-9c076eed8504.3388f1fa-8d02-4242-937a-538842ac1b41.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State d85a39d4-7d29-4054-8eea-9c076eed8504.4f154cab-1ce5-4112-b58c-ca536875e021.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State d85a39d4-7d29-4054-8eea-9c076eed8504.5cf34a3e-b2d0-4754-99ae-9b753d35cece.description=This flow will format and mount initial and additional datadisks to virtual and physical servers. The inputs are\: server.os Mandatory - should contain 'win' in case of windows, and '2008' or '2012' to make a difference between those two isAdditional Mandatory - should be 'True' if the disk that is added is not the first initial datadisk, but an additional one lun.wwname Only required for additional Linux datadisks disk.filesystem Only required for Linux servers server.hostname Madatory disk.mountpoint Not used at the moment. Can be used later to specifiy a mountpoint. See memo in the flow. disk.size Mandatory for Windows (All servers), and for Linux virtual servers isVirtual Mandatory - should be 'True' if the server is a virtual server. False for physical servers d85a39d4-7d29-4054-8eea-9c076eed8504.8b0277ae-6642-4ec4-8e4c-7c89e9ea40b4.description=
Generate Run URL - Generates an href HTML link that contains a URL to the run history report for the current run.

Inputs\:
    variablename  - The name of the flow variable where the result should be stored.
Default value\: IC_ReportURL
    displaytext - The text to display for the href link. 
Default\: "Run History Report Available Here"

Results\:
    result - The untagged URL to the run report for the current run.
Example (with default values)\: IC_ReportURL ,Run History Report Available Here

Responses\:
    success - The flow completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The flow completed unsuccessfully.
d85a39d4-7d29-4054-8eea-9c076eed8504.8b91e6f8-a231-4a47-b284-dd3c555cd719.description=This flow with send an email notifying the Support team that the email notification to the creator failed. Input Values\: vm.requester.email - The email address from the prior step result htmldocument - THe email body text from the prior result d85a39d4-7d29-4054-8eea-9c076eed8504.94aec501-d31d-4e03-b334-2c61e7157494.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State d85a39d4-7d29-4054-8eea-9c076eed8504.description=Purpose\: This OO flow creates a shared disk on 3par and rescans the disks on the OS to make it visible to a user in case of Linux, in case of Windows the disk is formatted on the primary server. This is to give the user a lifecycle action to add additional shared disks in a cluster. Prerequisites\: - The cluster is up and running as an active subscription - A hostset has been created for the cluster and its name is the cluster name Implementation\: The flow starts with the default get user identifier to get the user identifier for the inbound OO user in CSA. Then the flow gets the primary server component ID using the default get artifact details flow. With the primary server component ID the previously created subflow DB_GetDetailsBySubscriptionID to query the InfraDB for details on the subscription. After that the cloudcell information is queried by the previously created getCPG subflow and the 3par host is selected. After getting all details for server and subscription, the flow creates a volume on 3Par and presents it to the hostset as it has already done for the flow which creates a quorum disk.The subflow AddSharedDiskPostprocessingCluster is launched to add the disk to the specific OS. When this completes, CSA is informed that the flow has been succesful, thus completing the lifecycle action. d85a39d4-7d29-4054-8eea-9c076eed8504.e6025c24-bf76-44d7-8319-c55fa2b756fa.description=This workflow returns the component properties and values using Artifact APIs. result\: propertyNameValuesList\: pipe separated list of property name and values ( where each property name and values would be ; seprated and multiple values would be , seprated) e.g. - property 1; value1,value2|property 2; value3|property 3; value3,value4|........
flow.name: pc_lc_add_shared_disk
